page.title: 06LOCAL BREWERY EXPANDS
page.content: {Belhaven Brewery}has extended its operations by buying new premises ,amounting to 30,000 square feet,at Spott Road Industrial Estate. The units will be used primarily for the firms distribution, cellar, servicing, services sales and administration, allowing the site at Belhaven to be used for brewing and packaging. The need for expansion arose from the continuing growth in sales in the past few years. Belhaven has outgrown the existing facilities. The option of building on sites in Lanarkshire and West Lothian arose, and indeed much cost would have been saved by locating the distribution centre closer to the heart of their principal trading area, Central Scotland. But it was decided that the money was not as important as retaining the Dunbar workforce.
